organic.title: Vintage Corning Ware Patterns - 1958-2001

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Which old CorningWare is valuable?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: “The Cornflower range, with a blue floral design, is the most common pattern but is still worth a lot of money,” the Australian site said. “More rare patterns, like Wildflower - made from 1977 to 1984 - and Floral Bouquet - made from 1971 to 1975 - can fetch up to $10,000 online.”

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I know if my CorningWare is rare?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Some rare patterns include CorningWare's Black Starburst (percolator only), pattern produced from 1959-1963, the Blue Heather pattern produced from 1976-77 and the Butterscotch pattern produced in 1969 only.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the oldest CorningWare design?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The first pattern produced was Wheat; it was test marketed in 1958.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much is La Marjolaine CorningWare worth?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: A set of 1960 to 1970s Corning Ware casserole dishes with Pyrex lids in the Spice of Life (la marjolaine) pattern have a value of $15 to $25 each. There is currently a viral Facebook share and internet article that is falsely telling people that these are worth $10,000.
